comments:
Whenever I try and build a target from the ant view the console view flashes to
the front and almost instantly displays a terminated message:
<terminated> server-tools build.xml [deploy] [Ant Build]
D:\Java\SDK\Current\bin\javaw.exe (23-Jun-2005 14:58:38

The console doesn't contain any output.

The Error Log shows (a while later):
Error 2005-06-23 14:58:48.858 Error logged from Ant UI:
java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Accept timed out
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(Unknown Source)
at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(Unknown Source)
at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(Unknown Source)
at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.RemoteAntBuildListener$ServerConnection.run(RemoteAntBuildListener.java:97)

A collegue reports that RC1 behaved similarly but with an error dialog box

Very likely a duplicate of bug 101224 and bug 101150.
Ensure that you are not pointing to the old Ant plugin in your Ant runtime 
classpath.
Hitting "restore defaults" is the easiest way to clear up the problem

With nothing further from the reporter...marking as a dup

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 101150 ***
